job_title: Entry Level IT Technician in Lebanon, IL
pros: Great people and students on campus
cons: The board at the school seems shady at times

review_title: Do not go down with this sinking ship.
pros: - Other administrators are very friendly.
cons:
- There is no communication whatsoever. You find out things about your own job or compensation by accident or whenever supervisors decide to spring it on you. 
- Salaries are abysmal in relation to the amount of work placed on you. If you plan on living anywhere except Lebanon (which I would highly recommend against), you will likely need supplemental income.
- Students are very entitled and highly disrespectful. It's very rare that I have an interaction with a student or their equally entitled parent which doesn't revolve around the student getting their way, no matter what policies and procedures are already in place. 
- There is a very severe financial crisis that is being pitifully downplayed. Enrollment is down, retention is down, budgets are being cut very often. I would not recommend beginning a career here unless you would like to be out of a job in a few years when the doors close.

It's very upsetting that many of my colleagues have fallen for the "family-feel" mentality that McKendree wants their employees to adopt. This rigid and directionless company will not treat you like family but they'll try to instill that so that you don't complain.

pros: Great relationship with teachers and a wonderful learning environment. Buildings and sports facilities are all relatively close by which is great.
cons: Located in a small town. Some buildings are out of date and tuition is high. Campus expansion is desired by all students.
